page.title: 09Warmington Village #1
page.content: The Village lies on the North East slope of the valley and is a splendid example of an "Old English Village". As conservation control here is very strict,there have been less than 20 houses built over the past 20 years.A new group of 8 houses have been carefully fitted into the background, in a similar style to those adjacent. The layout and unspoilt beaty,with the golden mellowness of the local Hornton stone,is muh admired by visitors. Many American tourists visit each year,from Hotels in nearby Stratford upon Avon,being "bussed in" for the evening to relish the atmosphere and visit the local Pub"{The Plough".} The Village is built around a large triangular Green which is centered by a large Duck pond filled with water lilies and a good family of Ducks.The 17th Century{Manor House}dominates it.
